cards.rules_text:
When Timeless Heartwood enters the battlefield, search your library for a card named Heart of the Sea or a card named Soul of Fire, reveal it, shuffle, then put it on top of your library.
Tap artifacts you control named Eternity's Horizon, Heart of the Sea, Bones of the Earth, Soul of Fire, and Timeless Heartwood: Target player loses the game.

When Scholar of Harbaz enters the battlefield, it studies. [i](Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a noncreature, nonland card. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card on the top or bottom of your library.)[/i]

Arbitrate. [i](You may remove a counter from target player. If you do, another target player gets a counter of the same kind. Repeat this process for creatures, then for noncreature permanents.)[/i]
Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“All this should be yours, Qirauz. It will be.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, for each judgment counter you have, choose one —
• [b]Penance [/b]— You lose 1 life.
• [b]Tithe [/b]— Target opponent creates a tapped Treasure token. You lose a judgment counter.

Whenever Emperor's Hand deals combat damage to an opponent, that player gets that many judgment counters. [i](At the beginning of a player's upkeep, for each judgment counter, they choose one—Lose 1 life, or lose a judgment counter and choose an opponent to create a Treasure token.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Clad in the finest armor, emperor Qamurab's guard act as soldiers, police, and jury.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Dakazhi Judge enters the battlefield, each player gets a judgment counter. [i](At the beginning of a player's upkeep, for each judgment counter, they choose one—Lose 1 life, or lose a judgment counter and choose an opponent to create a Treasure token.)[/i]
{1}{U}{B}, {T}: Arbitrate. [i](You may remove a counter from target player. If you do, another target player gets a counter of the same kind. Repeat this process for creatures, then for noncreature permanents.)[/i]

When Prince's Tutor enters the battlefield, it studies. [i](Reveal the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand if it's a noncreature, nonland card. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature, then put the card on the top or bottom of your library.)[/i]
Whenever another creature you control studies, put a +1/+1 counter on Prince's Tutor.

Destroy target creature. Its controller gets a judgment counter. [i](At the beginning of a player's upkeep, for each judgment counter, they choose one—Lose 1 life, or lose a judgment counter and choose an opponent to create a Treasure token.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Qamurab's law is absolute. It knows no nuance, no mercy, no reprieve.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Sculptures you control get +1/+1.
Engrave 3—{3}{U}{R} [i](If you cast this spell for {3}{U}{R}, when it enters the battlefield, create a 0/0 Sculpture artifact creature token, then distribute three +1/+1 counters among Sculptures you control.)[/i]

Engrave 3—{3}{B}{G} [i](If you cast this spell for {3}{B}{G}, create a 0/0 Sculpture artifact creature token, then distribute three +1/+1 counters among Sculptures you control.)[/i]
Draw a card for each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. Those creatures gain haste and menace until end of turn.
Spells you cast for their engrave cost and artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Emperor Qamurab intends for the cities of Akaddi to last forever, and funds lavish works to endure the aeons.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{W}{U} JUDGMENT TAPOUT Cast judgment upon your foes with strong control effects.
{U}{B} ARBITRATE Move judgment and +1/+1 counters, and justice is yours to decide.
{B}{R} SPELLSLINGER Cast noncreature spells to boost your board presence.
{R}{G} STUDY Your creatures can research new spells or grow stronger.
{G}{W} SACRIFICE Your loss is no one's gain. Sacrifice creatures and Treasures for profit. 
{W}{B} JUDGMENT CONTROL Wait patiently to pass judgment upon the enemy.
{B}{G} +1/+1 COUNTERS Grow your creatures through study and engraving.
{G}{U} ARTIFACTS Build monuments and engrave your legacy with artifact spells.
{U}{R} SCULPTURES The living statuary of Akaddi is yours to command.
{R}{W} HARMONY Attack with both artifact and nonartifact creatures for bonuses.
Each player exiles all nonland permanent cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all nonland permanents they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

Choose one —
• Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• Reveal an artifact card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Combined, the royal treasures held great power.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Exile the top two cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Prince Qirauz ached for the throne of Akaddi, his birthright. As a man of peace he could not stomach overthrowing his father by force. Surely there was another way...[/i]

cards.rules_text:
You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
Arbitrate. [i](You may remove a counter from target player. If you do, another target player gets a counter of the same kind. Repeat this process for creatures, then for noncreature permanents.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“This is all yours, my son. I merely steward it until the day you are ready.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“There are secrets, Qirauz, hidden in your father's treasuries.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Exile target spell.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Qirauz paused for a moment, struck by visions of his kingdom's demise. Was the throne worth the risk? But his hesitation was merely momentary, and he uttered the words that would move time itself.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Defender
cards.flavor_text: [i]Each night as his father slept, Qirauz gazed longingly at the royal throne. It would be his one day, but one day would never be soon enough.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The ritual completed, Qirauz opened his eyes—or what was left of them. His glorious empire stretched for miles around him; miles of ash, dust, and bone.[/i]

cards.rules_text: For each judgment counter each player has, that player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Qirauz's impatience leered mockingly back at him from the empty eye sockets of his people. His ritual had left him the skeleton king of an empire of the dead.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Take an extra turn after this one. You get five judgment counters. Exile Ritual of Time. [i](At the beginning of a player's upkeep, for each judgment counter, they choose one—Lose 1 life, or lose a judgment counter and choose an opponent to create a Treasure token.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]The five relics were gathered, their power growing with their proximity. With the right words, Qirauz would be thrown forward in time, ready to accept his long-awaited coronation.[/i]

{X}, Exile a creature card with mana value X from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of the exiled card, except it's a Sculpture artifact creature and has haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

X can't be 0.

When Enforced Humility enters the battlefield, each opponent gets a judgment counter. [i](At the beginning of a player's upkeep, for each judgment counter, they choose one—Lose 1 life, or lose a judgment counter and choose an opponent to create a Treasure token.)[/i]
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {X} for each creature they control that's attacking you, where X is the number of judgment counters they have.

If one or more counters would be put on a permanent you don't control, you may have that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters be put on that permanent instead.
If a player would get one or more counters, you may have that player get that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters instead.

Instant and sorcery spells you control and permanents you control have deathtouch.
